Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Main controller for the Tetris game GUI.

This class manages the user interface, handles user input, and coordinates between the view components and game logic. It serves as the central hub for all UI-related operations including menus, gameplay display, and theme management. The controller implements JavaFX's Initializable interface to set up the UI after FXML components are loaded.

Functionality:

  • Initialize and manage UI components
  • Handle user input and button actions
  • Coordinate with helper classes for rendering and state management
  • Update displays based on game events
  • Manage game modes (Classic and Time Attack)

    • leaderboardButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button leaderboardButton

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiController

      public GuiController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the controller after FXML components are loaded.

      Sets up the initial UI state, creates helper objects (ViewManager, PieceRenderer, ThemeManager, LeaderboardView), loads high scores, configures input handlers, and initializes all preview panels. This method is automatically called by JavaFX after the FXML file has been loaded.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - the location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if unknown
      resources - the resources used to localize the root object, or null if not localized

    • setGameController

      public void setGameController(GameController gameController)
      Sets the GameController for this controller.

      Establishes the connection to the game logic controller and updates the mode indicator to reflect the current game mode.

      Parameters:
      gameController - the GameController instance managing game logic and state

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Sets the InputEventListener for game logic callbacks.

      Establishes the connection between UI input events and game logic by providing the listener that will process move, rotate, and other game events.

      Parameters:
      eventListener - the InputEventListener to handle game logic callbacks

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the game view with the board matrix and initial piece.

      Sets up the display grid by creating Rectangle objects for each board cell, configures game panel dimensions, and creates initial rectangles for the current piece and its ghost preview. Also initializes and starts the game timeline for automatic piece dropping.

      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the 2D array representing the game board state
      brick - the ViewData containing the initial piece information

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the brick display after a move.

      Updates the piece rectangles if the piece shape has changed (such as after rotation), updates the position of all piece blocks, updates the ghost piece preview, and refreshes the next piece previews from the generator.

      Parameters:
      brick - the ViewData containing updated information for the current piece

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the game background based on the board matrix.

      Updates the display matrix rectangles to show locked pieces that have been placed on the board. Called after pieces are locked in place.

      Parameters:
      board - the 2D array representing the current game board state

    • hardDrop

      public void hardDrop()
      Performs a hard drop of the current piece.

      Instantly drops the piece to its landing position and locks it in place. Displays score notifications if any lines are cleared as a result, and refreshes the display with the new board state.

    • updateNextPieces

      public void updateNextPieces(List<int[][]> nextBrickDataList)
      Updates all next piece preview panels with new piece data.

      Renders each upcoming piece in its corresponding preview panel. If fewer pieces are available than preview slots, remaining panels are cleared.

      Parameters:
      nextBrickDataList - the list of 2D arrays representing upcoming pieces

    • holdPiece

      public void holdPiece(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the hold piece action.

      Swaps the current piece with the held piece, or stores the current piece if no piece is currently held. Updates the hold display panel and refreshes the current piece display. Returns early if the game is over or paused.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from button click, or null if triggered by keyboard

    • updateHoldPieceDisplay

      public void updateHoldPieceDisplay(int[][] holdPieceData)
      Updates the hold piece display panel.

      Renders the specified piece data in the hold panel, or clears the panel if null is provided (indicating no piece is currently held).

      Parameters:
      holdPieceData - the 2D array representing the held piece, or null if empty

    • setHoldEnabled

      public void setHoldEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether the hold feature is enabled or disabled.

      Updates the hold button styling to visually indicate whether the hold action is currently available or has already been used for this piece.

      Parameters:
      enabled - true if hold is available, false if already used

    • bindScore

      public void bindScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty scoreProperty)
      Binds the score label to a score property.

      Establishes a binding so the score label automatically updates whenever the score property changes. Unbinds any previous binding first.

      Parameters:
      scoreProperty - the IntegerProperty to bind to the score label

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Handles the game over state.

      Stops the game timeline, displays the game over screen, sets the game over flag, and updates the high score label if a new high score was achieved.

    • newGame

      public void newGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Starts a new game.

      Resets game state flags, hides game over and pause menus, updates the high score label, creates a fresh game through the event listener, initializes a new game timeline with appropriate speed for the current mode, and starts automatic piece dropping.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from button click, or null if triggered programmatically

    • updateHighScoreLabel

      public void updateHighScoreLabel(int highscore)
      Updates the high score label.

      Sets the text of the high score label to display the provided value.

      Parameters:
      highscore - the new high score value to display

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Toggles the pause state of the game.

      If the game is currently paused, resumes gameplay by hiding the pause menu, resuming the game controller, and restarting the timeline. If not paused, pauses the game by showing the pause menu and stopping the timeline. Has no effect if the game is over.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from button click, or null if triggered by keyboard

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game.

      External method to pause the game by stopping the timeline and pausing the game controller. Used when pause needs to be triggered programmatically rather than through user input.

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Restarts the current game.

      Delegates to newGame to reset and start a fresh game session.

      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent from the restart button

    • quitGame

      public void quitGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Quits the application.

      Terminates the application immediately by calling System.exit.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the quit button

    • backToMainMenu

      public void backToMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Returns to the main menu from any screen.

      Stops the game timeline, pauses the game controller, resets game state flags, hides all game screens and menus, and shows the home menu.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the back to menu button

    • startGameFromHowToPlay

      public void startGameFromHowToPlay(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Starts the game from the How to Play screen.

      Stops any existing timeline, hides the how to play menu, shows the game board, starts the selected game mode (Classic or Time Attack), creates a new game timeline with appropriate speed, and resets game state flags.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the start game button

    • backToMainMenuFromHowToPlay

      public void backToMainMenuFromHowToPlay(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Returns to main menu from How to Play screen.

      Delegates to the main backToMainMenu method.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the back button

    • showThemes

      public void showThemes(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Shows the theme selection menu.

      Uses the ViewManager to display the themes screen where users can choose different visual themes for the application.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the themes button

    • backToMainMenuFromThemes

      public void backToMainMenuFromThemes(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Returns to main menu from themes screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent

    • setDefaultTheme

      public void setDefaultTheme(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Applies the default theme.

      Uses the ThemeManager to apply the default visual theme to the root pane and menus, then returns to the main menu.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the theme button

    • setCountrysideTheme

      public void setCountrysideTheme(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Applies the countryside theme.

      Uses the ThemeManager to apply the countryside visual theme to the root pane and menus, then returns to the main menu.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the theme button

    • setBeachTheme

      public void setBeachTheme(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Applies the beach theme.

      Uses the ThemeManager to apply the beach visual theme to the root pane and menus, then returns to the main menu.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the theme button

    • setTronTheme

      public void setTronTheme(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Applies the tron theme.

      Uses the ThemeManager to apply the tron visual theme to the root pane and menus, then returns to the main menu.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent from the theme button

    • showHowToPlayForClassic

      public void showHowToPlayForClassic()
      Prepares to start Classic mode.

      Sets the internal mode flag to Classic and displays the How to Play screen with Classic mode styling and instructions.

    • showHowToPlayForTimeAttack

      public void showHowToPlayForTimeAttack()
      Prepares to start Time Attack mode.

      Sets the internal mode flag to Time Attack and displays the How to Play screen with Time Attack mode styling and instructions.

    • updateTimer

      public void updateTimer(int seconds)
      Updates the timer display.

      Formats and displays the remaining time in MM:SS format. Changes the color to red if time is critical, orange if low, or orange if normal.

      Parameters:
      seconds - the remaining seconds in Time Attack mode

    • showTimer

      public void showTimer()
      Shows the timer label.

      Makes the timer label visible for Time Attack mode.

    • hideTimer

      public void hideTimer()
      Hides the timer label.

      Hides the timer label for Classic mode or when not needed.

    • showLeaderboard

      public void showLeaderboard()
      Shows the leaderboard.

      Defaults to displaying the Classic mode leaderboard.

    • closeLeaderboard

      public void closeLeaderboard()
      Closes the leaderboard display.

      Hides the leaderboard view and returns focus to the game panel.

    • showClassicLeaderboard

      public void showClassicLeaderboard()
      Shows the Classic mode leaderboard.

      Retrieves top scores for Classic mode from the game controller and displays them in the leaderboard view.

    • showTimeAttackLeaderboard

      public void showTimeAttackLeaderboard()
      Shows the Time Attack mode leaderboard.

      Retrieves top scores for Time Attack mode from the game controller and displays them in the leaderboard view.

    • showGameOver

      public void showGameOver(int score, String mode)
      Shows the game over screen with final score.

      Displays the game mode and final score in the notification area.

      Parameters:
      score - the final score achieved
      mode - the game mode name ("Classic" or "Time Attack")
